The South is calling to God for temporal and spiritual food, but it has been so long neglected that hearts have become hard as stone. God's people need now to arouse and redeem their sinful neglect and indifference of the past. These obligations now rest heavily upon the churches, and God will graciously pour out His Spirit upon those who will take up their God-given work. [MS., MARCH 2, 1897. PUBLISHED IN BOOKLET, "THE SOUTHERN WORK," PP. 109, 110, 114, 115, UNDER HEADING, "THE SOUTHERN FIELD."]
